greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A335880(sigma(i)) = A335880(sigma(j)), for all i, j >= 1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the function f(n) = A335880(A000203(n)), or equally, of the ordered pair [A336928(n), A336929(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 11 2020
